German[edit]

German Wikipedia has an article on:
Maschine
Wikipedia de

Etymology[edit]

Borrowed from French machine (“machine”), from Latin machina.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /maˈʃiːnə/
  • Audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Maschine f (genitive Maschine, plural Maschinen)

  1. machine
  2. engine
  3. (slightly informal) airplane
  4. (colloquial) motorcycle

Usage notes[edit]

  • The word is not usual for vending machines and similar machines into which money is inserted (like a pinball machine or the like). These are called Automaten.

Declension[edit]

Derived terms[edit]

  • Bohrmaschine f (“drill”)
  • Fräsmaschine f (“milling machine”)
  • Kaffeemaschine f (“coffee maker”)
  • Küchenmaschine f (“food processor”)
  • Maschinenraum f (“engine room”)
  • Schreibmaschine f (“typewriter”)
  • Spülmaschine f (“dishwasher”)
  • Suchmaschine f (“search engine”)
  • Trockenmaschine f
  • Waschmaschine f (“washing machine”)
 

Descendants[edit]

  • → Hungarian: masina
  • → Belarusian: машына (mašyna)
  • → Bulgarian: машина (mašina)
  • → Czech: mašina
  • → Macedonian: машина (mašina)
  • → Latvian: mašīna
  • → Lithuanian: mašina
  • → Lower Sorbian: mašina
  • → Romanian: mașină (also directly from French)
  • → Russian: машина (mašina) (see there for further descendants)
  • → Serbo-Croatian: машина / mašina
  • → Slovak: mašina
  • → Slovene: mašina
  • → Ukrainian: машина (mašyna)
  • → Yiddish: מאַשין‎ (mashin)
